title: uche6215
author: uche6215
content: I want to ask a question. And I need serious answer from this forum, and my question is WHY DOES A GAMBLER DON'T HAVE A SAVINGS.In my country (Nigeria) there are many gamblers who don't have savings and it isn't help matters at all. Most of these gamblers can't afford for there families but they can afford money they will use to gamble. So why are they not having savings that they can use to help there families in time of lack. Like they said, we save money so money can save us tomorrow. But these gamblers doesn't know that.

comments.author: Oshosondy
comments.body: Gambler that do not plan and have good budget for important things will not have savings. Gambler that spend more than expecting to gambling with may not have savings. Addicts may not also have savings. I know the situation in Nigeria, it is a nation with many unemployed youths. Some people can think they can gamble with low amount of money to win big amount of money, that happens to some Nigerians, they lose small all the time because they want to win big accumulated bet.

comments.author: serjent05
comments.body: Not all gamblers don't have savings.  There are gamblers that do have savings, it is that they just don't tell people they do have.  Gamblers that have self-control and play only to have a fund that uses the money they afford to lose in gambling do have savings.In most cases, the gambler who don't have savings are most likely people that are addicted to gambling.  Since they have this uncontrollable urge, they just gamble all their money away.  Worst they also have debt everywhere.

comments.author: Agbe
comments.body: There is no day that you ask a gambler for money that would give it to you. Gambler is always break even those you see cash in his hand he would still tell you that there is no money because he is going to use it to play gamble. Not that gamblers do not have savings but there savings are for gambling. But there are some gamblers that give money to their family members and friends, all gamblers are not the same. Even though a gambler does not give money to his family people he give it to his GF, if there is no savings there how will he give to her. So not all are like that. There are some that have savings.

comments.author: KennyR
comments.body: This is the effect of gambling. Once you get used to it, really hard to get back to your regular life. In the past there were these kind of gamblers who ruin themselves and their families. Now things have changed and most of them used to spend what they can afford to loss. At times when luck doesn't favour, they go for borrowing and things go out of control. Gambling with limits is enjoyable, and when things go out of hand it will turn to be big problem for the person as well as the family.

comments.body: this doesn't just happen with gamblers but with a large portion of the population that lives (regardless of its income) paycheck to paycheck every month! in the end this is the fault of our extremely/endless consumerist society that leads you to buy objects or services not for a utility.

comments.author: coolcoinz
comments.body: because gambling can be an addiction for many people and this is not the problem of gambling itself but of people who allow themselves to be addicted. It's our human weakness.I'll give you an example. I have a friend who is addicted to smoking and he's also a frequent drinker. I wouldn't call him an alcoholic but he's getting there. He also barely has any money, despite having a decent job. He drives the most destroyed car I've ever seen where seats are ripped to the point where he sits on bare foam, but he always has money for smokes and beer. Also, this thread should be in gambling discussion.

comments.author: usekevin
comments.body: It’s not a fully true statement,maybe you had come across 70 percentage of the gamblers.It means most of the gamblers will not hold the funds for the next trade.They will have the attitude of all in all the time.Some time they will earn huge and some times they will loss some.They also have the attitude of the partial win will be placed on the new bet.The high risk was the important character of the real gamblers.Some people the rest of 30 percentage will do the trade of analysis and keep the backup of 30 percentage all the time in their wallet.Not in Nigeria,most of the European Nations and the United States also made the empty wallet for the next wallet.Such people think the holding for the next trade is not a way of gambling.My suggestion will be hold some for the backup and to recover the loss money to gambling.

comments.author: panganib999
comments.body: I think this thread's supposed to be in the Gambling Discussion. But I digress. Gambler's especially those that are impoverished, gamble because they want to get out of poverty and live that lavish life. The connection between lack of savings and gambling is a stretch if you'll ask me. It's like saying why are poor people gambling? Moreover, gambling in a poor man's eye isn't a form of entertainment, it's an avenue to get rich quick without taking the grueling path of working yourself to death for financial freedom, which I can get behind since who doesn't want a few million bucks on their bank account just because you're lucky that you guessed the right numbers yeah? But it all comes full circle. it basically warrants the fact that most marginalized gamblers will not have savings, not because they are dumbfucks who aren't financially literate enough to save money for their future, but because they would rather focus on making sure they don't starve to death, before putting up money for savings and investment.

And I need serious answer from this forum, and my question is WHY DOES A GAMBLER DON'T HAVE A SAVINGS.You're generalizing and this is never a good idea.There are a lot of people from everywhere that don't have savings without being gamblers, the same thing is the other way around, there are enough gamblers who have more savings than the average non-gambler:https://www.bi.team/blogs/dealing-new-data-what-bank-transactions-can-tell-us-about-gambling-behaviour/QuoteA new survey has found that 29% of Europeans don’t have any personal savings, neither do 16% of Americans nor 23% of Australians.vsMonzo’s below-average gamblers contributed 42 times as much money into interest-earning savings accounts than they spent on gambling, while above-average gamblers contributed only 0.1 times as much as they spent on gambling. Also, since you're a gambler yourself, does that mean you don't have any savings also?QuoteI just stick real Madrid to win Valencia with my last $100 and the odds just increased woooHmm, look who's calling the kettle black!
